reviews.text:
What a stunning hotel. The top floor terrace room was incredible. Being able to see the Eiffel Tower and notre dame from your room is unbeatable! The service was fantastic, we really enjoyed the front desk. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean and spacious, a/c saved our butts, and the bathroom was sufficient. We had no noise in our room, which is impressive given its superb location.
The breakfast was not reliable. We had to wait a very long time for delivery to our room. I prepaid for each day breakfast, and one day it took so long we never got it… missed out on 40€. The elevator is also very tiny and slow, so plan accordingly.
Besides breakfast (recommend you skip), this hotel is really incredible.

This hotel was absolutely perfect for our trip. The accommodations were comfortable and the hotel is located in a great area. The reception with champagne was a nice touch and the breakfast offerings were great. All amenities were perfect, but the courtesy and helpfulness of the staff truly was remarkable. They were so friendly and went out of their way to make sure that we were comfortable, and really took their time to provide us great recommendations. Thanks especially to Vladimir and Adam who spent time to help us navigate and suggest how to spend our short time in Paris. We very much hope to return.

Rooms are small, but large for Paris standards. Our room had a small balcony with a view of the city and a table for 2. The location cannot be beat. It’s tucked away off of the main road, but very close to Notre Dame and many other sites. We walked everywhere. Many small restaurants near-bye. I felt very safe and the staff were courteous and helpful. Air conditioning was a huge plus as we visited in August. I would definitely stay again!

We had a very pleasurable stay at the Parc Saint-Severin Paris. The hotel staff was super friendly and helpful. We booked a superior double room. The room was very spacious, clean, functional and safe. The hotel is walking distance from most major attractions. We therefore did not have to book and pay for any Taxis. I will return to this hotel when I visit Paris again.

Directly in the centre of the Latin Quarter, surrounded by bustling streets full of bars and restaurants, only minutes from Notre Dahm, this beautiful little hotel is in a quiet street with almost no tourists or road noise, it's almost impossibly quiet for the location. The staff are amazing and knew us all by name within a couple of days. The rooms are small but comfortable. We will stay here again.

editorial_summary.overview: Refined rooms in a polished hotel with Wi-Fi & a business center, plus a breakfast room.

Ordered the Capannina pizza, it had the right amount of spiciness from the italian sausages, the dough was cooked to perfection, it was a great meal.
The waiters were very attentive, the order arrived within minutes although it was very busy. Recommend this place.
The service was great. The food was absolutely fabulous. My husband is a pizza snob and he could not say enough good things about it. Great wine selection. Beautiful desserts. 15/10 recommend.
The owner was so amazing! Such a sweet and genuine guy! He gave us great recommendations for the food. We had bruschetta and the truffle pizza. Highly recommend!!!

Excellent, welcoming restaurant located in one of Paris's most beautiful neighborhoods. The service is good and punctual, and the staff is generally friendly and courteous. We had two pizzas and a salad, but that was enough to understand that this is authentic Italian cuisine, worthy of its name.

Managed to get a walk-in table for my family of 4 and were greeted and served by the owner, such a nice guy.
The food was amazing. We all shared bruschetta,  pizza, a pasta and gnocchi dishes. All we're delicious. Great food, great service and overall fantastic little restaurant. Would definitely recommend.

Day 1.name: Romanian Orthodox Church of the Holy Archangels
Day 1.address: 9 Bis Rue Jean de Beauvais, Paris

reviews.text:
Situated in the heart of Paris, the Romanian Orthodox Church of the Holy Archangels offers a peaceful and intimate retreat from the city’s usual bustle.

We visited the Church for a wedding, and it was a truly memorable experience. The church may be modest in size, but it radiates a deep sense of peace and tradition.
Sublime.
Beautiful orthodox church with small coin for souvenirs shop!

Quite small for the needs of a cathedral. It has it's place in most classic touristic tours and a statue of Eminescu very close. Inside the original paintings were restored and it truly serves it's purpose of a place for God.
Historical Church and main Romanian Orthodox Cathedral in Paris. The place where the great sculptor Constantin Brâncuși worshipped.

reviews.text: Great food in a charming atmosphere, set in one of the oldest buildings in Paris. We tried the lunch menu and were delighted with every dish. The highlights were the meat and artichoke, and the croissant/brioche served with golden butter.

The food, service, and value for money are all excellent. I was very satisfied with the meal, and the service was also excellent. I highly recommend visiting if you come to Paris. Additionally, the bathrooms are the cleanest and most well-equipped of all the ones I've seen in Paris. Everything is perfect.

I was part of a group of 3 that dined here in September. It was an amazing experience. The combination of the flavors and creativity of the food really shines, and the service was outstanding. I will be sure to reserve another dining experience here if I visit Paris again!

My first Michelin restaurant. I walked away with a beautiful experience, but my stomach couldn't handle all the different ingredients. I'm not allergic to anything, but something didn't agree with me. We tried the tasting menu, but had to stop mid-way because it was too much food for me.

Genius and delicious food, I took the 5 courses Thank you sincerely to the chef first of all and the kitchen team for the genius amazing taste that i couldn’t believe how delicious it was and how the mix was unique and creative and very fun to eat , I felt so happy with each course. Thank you to Antoine and Bathilde for making my experience amazing with your help explanation taking care of me and smiles

Day 1.name: Nazareth Synagogue
Day 1.address: 15 Rue Notre Dame de Nazareth, Paris

reviews.text: Beautiful. Majestic. Holy. Impressive. Beautiful blue and yellow decorations soar high above the sanctuary. Soaring ceilings and delicate chandeliers provide a sense of being in a holy place. Incredible stained glass decorations provide a delicious splash of color in the ceiling and above the balcony. Such a beautiful Synagogue.
Nice synagogue, Good place for daily prayer at the center of Paris.
Beautiful synagogue and a welcoming community.
Beautiful place of worship. Needs a lot of security because of local Muslim threats
Visited the Temple in April 2023.Had a very educative tour of the Temple.

reviews.text:
Had a great first leg of our trip at this hotel. Such a great staff, beautiful room, centrally located. Walking distance to everything in the heart of Paris. Great food options all around, shopping, etc.

Stayed as a family of four with small children. Would love to return one day.

Relais Christine is one of our most favorite hotels in the world! We LOVE the staff and the quiet elegance of the experience provided. The rooms are full of comfort and luxury surroundings, lovely spa and wonderful breakfast. We are hoping to return soon!!

My husband and I recently visited Paris and stayed at Relais Christine. This was my second time staying at this hotel (the first time was in 2016) and it met and exceeded all of my expectations. The staff is wonderful, the property is lovely, the rooms are nice with great bedding, the breakfast is delicious and the location is perfect. This is the only hotel I'll ever need to stay at in Paris!

Our two night stay at the Relais Christine was amazing.  The common spaces, as well as our room, were beautiful, and so comfortable. We were greeted by staff who met our every need at all times of day, and enjoyed a delicious breakfast and cappuccino each morning.  The bikes were a lovely touch, and some of our party enjoyed a morning bike ride to the Eiffel Tower!

Probably one of the poorest 5 star experience we’ve ever had, and I compare this to similar boutique experiences and not large chains.
I have booked via booking and was informed when selecting the Duplex that it holds a bedroom, a sofa bed and one extra bed is available upon request. Given that I traveled with my husband, two toddler children and our nanny, I have booked 2 identical rooms even though it was well above our needs. We got there and I was refused when requesting the extra bed not based on lack of availability but “french law”. Once I’ve shown the room description and confirmation a bed can be added I was suggested that one child can sleep in the other room(?!) or that we can have an upgrade the next day. It was not the lack of solution that bothered me ( as they know, i have made it work as it was and didn’t fall mesmerized by the free upgrade) - but the attitude and lack of understanding on what the issue actually was.

Another things that left me
baffled for a 5 stars experience - you need to figure out where breakfast is? how to reach a room service menu? basically a total lack of service or information available unless you intentionally seek it. And spoiled fresh juice at breakfast at 7 AM is hardly understandable.

Lastly, what probably made me even write this review was that we were given a checkout time of 1 PM on only one of the rooms and our request to keep it until 1:30 as we flew out at 4 was deemed as impossible.

It’s a great great location but the experience was exactly 3 stars, just like my rating.

details.adr_address: 3 Rue Christine, 75006 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Luxe quarters in a 16th-century mansion, plus free Wi-Fi, a spa, a salon & a posh lounge/bar.

details.name: Relais Christine

Lovely, cosy place to wine & dine.   The wine list is long and has a nice page of wines by the glass.   The lady serving the guests is enthousiastic and takes time to explain briefly the various wine options.
Kitchen staff is highly skilled and brings great food on your plate.   The menu has indeed Limited choice, but everything is top quality.
Well recommended...

Fantastic place! Go here! One of the best meals I had during my stay in Paris. I went early around 19:00 on a Friday and the restaurant was basically empty. Super friendly service in English. The anchovies were meaty and delicious, the tartare had good salt and anchovy flavor and the cod was superb (especially the sauce!). Snack (anchovy), starter (tartare), main (cod) and 3 drinks (champagne, white wine and Armagnac) came in at 109€. The restaurant is named after the street. The server said it’s not a Basque restaurant but more international with French influence. The chef is Mexican so you can also see that influence (delicious!).

This was the first and best dinner I had in Paris. They thoughtfully recommended a wine that paired perfectly with our dishes, which made the experience even more enjoyable. Although it was quite warm inside, the wonderful food and wine more than made up for it — we had a fantastic time.

Truly a PHENOMENAL meal. I’ve been to Paris before and this was one of the best meals I’ve ever had. A great neighborhood atmosphere where people want to hang out after their meal with exceptional service and perfection in their food. The beef tartare is a must as well as all of the plats. There is not a single thing I ordered I wouldn’t order again or recommend to anyone looking for a great meal in the city. Tom (Hi Tom!) gave us the best wine recommendations to accommodate the entire groups taste and truly made us feel at home. I cannot recommend this place enough.

This place is now on my list of places to recommend when friends ask for restaurant recommendations when they visit Paris. Very inventive flavor combos, with a little Mexican inspiration. I really liked the crunchy salad. Great wine selection. Service was very friendly but unusually slow. There are many great options in this neighborhood and this is one of the best I’ve found.

Nice collection of art. Very affordable/fair prices compared to many other museums and galleries. The collection wasn't as large as I imagined, especially being such a large building. But it's worth a visit. There are some great photo opportunities from above, and the impressionists art is fantastic.

This place is honestly incredible! Due to limited time I focused on my personal favourite - Impressionists but you could easily spend a whole day here. The building itself it stunning.

Would recommend going out of peak season, I visited in August and it was very busy. I wonder how it would feel with less hustle and bustle.

A memorable part of my trip to Paris!

Also there is a queue for tickets to be bought on the day. It was swift (5-10mins) and easy.

I'm using Paris Museum Pass, just join the line via Entrance C.

This is one of the coolest art museums in Paris, it’s a must-visit if you’re Van Gogh's fan or simply into art. What makes it really special is that the building itself used to be a huge train station, it was the Gare d’Orsay, built around the early 1900s. Instead of tearing it down, they turned it into a museum, which means you get this amazing mix of old industrial architecture and art all in one place.

Inside, the museum is packed with incredible artworks, mostly from the late 19th and early 20th centuries. You’ll find tons of famous Impressionist and Post-Impressionist paintings here, artists like Monet, Degas, Renoir, Van Gogh, and Cézanne. If you love those bright, colorful paintings or want to get a feel for the art that changed the world, this is the spot.

Besides paintings, the museum also has sculptures, decorative arts, and photography. It’s pretty manageable in size, so you don’t get overwhelmed like in some bigger museums.

The museum sits right on the left bank of the Seine, close to the Louvre and the charming Saint-Germain area. So, it’s easy to fit it into a day of exploring Paris.

It's recommended to visit here. :)

Everybody knows how fantastic these places. The museum itself is just simply fantastic.  Well organized and clean easy to get around. Advice: get Timed Tickets otherwise  lines are really long. Audio guide well worth a little extra to learn about the paintings. Many different spots to take photos.

The card can get very big around famous artists and pictures.

5 start!! Bring comfortable shoes :-)

Do not miss this architectural and artistic gem! Do a bit of research first so you target the areas of greatest interest. Impressionists and Art Nuveau were a must for me. Meals are available in various places and they are good. Only downside is the layout of the building, it can be confusing. But the staff were helpful and we found our way at the end. (Uploaded photos are from two different trips to the museum)

editorial_summary.overview: Major 19th- & 20th-century European art collections housed in a monumental, former railway station.

The food at Les Enfants Rouges was absolutely stunning every dish was beautifully crafted and full of flavor.
A true testament to the chef’s talent and passion. The wine selection was equally impressive, perfectly curated to complement the menu.
The cosy, intimate atmosphere adds to the charm it truly feels like a hidden gem tucked away in the heart of Paris.
Highly recommended for anyone seeking a memorable culinary experience!

Delicious adult food - Japanese/French.  Great with kids.  Kids menu was fancy breaded chicken with fries - excellent.  Litchi dessert was OUT. OF. THIS. WORLD.  Very small space off of a main street so not much of an atmosphere.

Wow. Second time here and was not disappointed.
The food is simply fantastic. Very well prepared and the blend of flavors is amazing and a delight to discover.
Don't miss out on the San Sebastian cheesecake!
The service is also excellent and elevates the whole experience.
Must go!

A friend who lives in Paris introduced the restaurant to us few years back. Since then, it becomes a go-to place whenever we’re in Paris, this is our 5th time last night.

Consistency of food quality is the key reason why we keep come back again.
Service is welcoming and not too much.
Seasoning of food is brilliant, we can taste each ingredient on the plate, and the food temperature is so well controlled.
The artisan level of plating also make me wonder why they aren’t Michelin yet!
Highly recommended! :-)

Les Enfants Rouges is a casual, cozy and lively restaurant with everyone comfortably seated in a way that really maximizes the space. The menu is set and everyone at the table gets a starter, main and dessert. The menu is simple but each dish is absolutely incredible. I would strongly recommend having everyone at the table order something different so you can try as many items as possible!

details.adr_address: 9 Rue de Beauce, 75003 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Classic French cuisine with a Japanese flair, artfully presented in a modern bistro setting.

details.name: Les Enfants Rouges

reviews.text:
The food at Les Enfants Rouges was absolutely stunning every dish was beautifully crafted and full of flavor.
A true testament to the chef’s talent and passion. The wine selection was equally impressive, perfectly curated to complement the menu.
The cosy, intimate atmosphere adds to the charm it truly feels like a hidden gem tucked away in the heart of Paris.
Highly recommended for anyone seeking a memorable culinary experience!

Delicious adult food - Japanese/French.  Great with kids.  Kids menu was fancy breaded chicken with fries - excellent.  Litchi dessert was OUT. OF. THIS. WORLD.  Very small space off of a main street so not much of an atmosphere.

Wow. Second time here and was not disappointed.
The food is simply fantastic. Very well prepared and the blend of flavors is amazing and a delight to discover.
Don't miss out on the San Sebastian cheesecake!
The service is also excellent and elevates the whole experience.
Must go!

A friend who lives in Paris introduced the restaurant to us few years back. Since then, it becomes a go-to place whenever we’re in Paris, this is our 5th time last night.

Consistency of food quality is the key reason why we keep come back again.
Service is welcoming and not too much.
Seasoning of food is brilliant, we can taste each ingredient on the plate, and the food temperature is so well controlled.
The artisan level of plating also make me wonder why they aren’t Michelin yet!
Highly recommended! :-)

Les Enfants Rouges is a casual, cozy and lively restaurant with everyone comfortably seated in a way that really maximizes the space. The menu is set and everyone at the table gets a starter, main and dessert. The menu is simple but each dish is absolutely incredible. I would strongly recommend having everyone at the table order something different so you can try as many items as possible!

This place brought me to tears and I'm not Jewish. Went to see the current temporary photographic exhibition not realising it was a memori to the lives of the French Jewish population during WWII and earlier. Such a humbling experience. It was free but I would've paid.
An incredibly profound and sad experience. Most placards have English translations, so the experience is not in any way diminished if a visitor does not speak French.
So powerful to see and remember the french jews, victims of a genocide,and stand with them and stand today facing history in our difficult times

This memorial is for the resistance fighters and Jewish people deported from France to concentration camps during WWII. It is very somber. The art is very well done and creates the feeling and mood I believe the artist was trying for. It is free to visit. Be certain to ask for the audio guide. (also free) as it explains a lot about the art and the history enshrined In the memorial.

Free to enter but please leave a donation to support this powerful memorial to the holocaust. While there are many emotional exhibits, the most moving is the interviews between French youth and Holocaust survivors with the theme of "I promise to be the memory of your memory. "

details.adr_address: 17 Rue Geoffroy l'Asnier, 75004 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Free-entry Holocaust museum & memorial with photographs, documents & multi-media displays.

We spend two nights in this lovely hotel and we were very happy! The personal is friendly, the room looked good. The breakfast was fresh and had a good quality. Overall it is a nice place to spend your holiday or your business trip. Thanks to it‘s location, you are fast in the city.

I cannot say enough good about this hotel. Upon arrival we were greeted by Thomas, who had a marvelous personality. He greeted us with a glass of champagne. Although he also offered beer or wine if you liked. He gave us great information regarding the area and answered all our questions. The rooms were beautiful and spotless. Bathrooms were good size with rain showers, nice hot water and toiletries. There was a Nepresso machine,  which we all love! As well as a Marshall speaker, so we could listen to our music. Highly recommend! All of the staff were fantastic.
Judy USA

We stayed at Le General Hotel for two nights and had such a lovely time. The location couldn’t be better—really central and just a minute from the metro, which made exploring Paris super easy. The staff were all so friendly and helpful, which we really appreciated. Our room was cosy and quiet, and the bed was very comfy! Loved the robe and slippers too, such a nice touch. Big thank you to the team for making our stay so enjoyable—we’d definitely come back and recommend this hotel when visiting Paris!

I stayed for two nights for my birthday and I have never been treated this nice in my life. Thomas especially, you are the most amazing man! I will forever be grateful for how you and all of your staff treated me and my friend. I hope I can come back as soon as possible and I hope I can repay you or at least the universe gives you endless good karma! ❤️ everything was so clean and nice and beds super comfy, location is amazing and felt so safe but the people were the highlight!

We loved our stay. Staff takes pride in their work. Great location right next to several metro stops that make the whole city easily accessible. Rooms were small but that’s normal for Paris. AC was a god-send on hot days. Great vibes in the lobby to hang out with free croissants and such. Would recommend!

details.adr_address: 5-7 Rue Rampon, 75011 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Cool, fashionable quarters with Nespresso machines & free Wi-Fi, plus a bar & a fitness room.

Delicious hot fresh foccacia sandwiches.

I love all the options they have; so this will suit anyone.

You can see the bread being baked fresh. And then again after they put in the toppings.

I went with the Stonker; which is fresh mozzarella cheese, tomatoes, arugula and olive oil. I made them add balsamic as well which made it even better.

€9 is a steal for such a big sandwich.

Order first and then lots of place to sit and eat upstairs.

Must visit in Paris.

Great place to have a budget friendly meal. I had the sandwich+drink+dessert combo. It was delicious, fresh, and at a very reasonable price. The only thing I would improve is the choice of drinks, as only a few sodas or water are available. A simple lemonade would have made my meal perfect.
High quality sandwiches quickly prepared. Staff was friendly and accommodating for our large order of 13 sandwiches!
Good food at reasonable prices...no French? Pas problème....feel welcome and leave warm and satisfied with a complet with soup...15 euros! Delicious Sandwich soup dessert and drink

This was a gem of a find. What I recommend is the delicious meal set with a sandwich, drink, and dessert. Pricing was a good value for the set =15 euros each (with an upgrade of cider as a drink-which was only 1.5 euro upgrade)

The upstairs dining area is a nice, cool retreat from the bustling streets of Paris. Water is offered from the tap, with a clean restroom for patrons. Compared to overfilled cafes steps away, this felt more relaxed.

details.adr_address: 54 Rue de Seine, 75006 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Counter-serve chain known for sandwiches & pizzas made with hearth-fired flatbreads, plus salads.

Day 3.name: Notre-Dame Cathedral of Paris
Day 3.address: Cathédrale Notre Dame, 6 Parvis Notre-Dame - Pl. Jean-Paul II, Paris

reviews.text: Wonderful to see the restored splendour of this magnificent cathedral after the awful fire of 2019.  Free to enter, long queue but moved quickly and only took about 20 minutes to get inside.  There was a mass taking place when we visited so it was very busy inside but it was lovely to hear the organ music and singing showcasing the wonderful acoustics.  I would recommend timing your visit to coincidence with a service as this is an experience not to be missed.  The artwork and stained glass are exquisite and you have a real sense of history as you walk round this remarkable building which had played such an central part in the story of the French nation.

Iconic cathedral, so well known, no review is needed.  It continues to be restored by artisans and workers who are preserving and restoring the structure to inspire people for generations.  Expect scaffolding to still be around the outside structure for another few years.  The inside is gorgeous and looks as good or better than it has in 900 years.  The walk-up lines move pretty quickly and the tours are worth it.  Bathrooms are not available on site.  Pay toilets are nearby.

You do not need a ticket to enter! There are tour companies selling tickets but honestly, get in the line (looks super long but moves super fast - it’s basically a continuous loop in, around, and out) and check out this iconic cathedral. Even if you’re not catholic or religious, you can appreciate the beauty and wonder in awe how it was built. It’s still under construction on the outside from the fire, but inside it’s great.

What an amazing symbol of Gothic architecture! This is one of the oldest Gothic cathedrals. It's located at the downtown of the beautiful city of Paris.

The building is very popular, so probably when you visit it, you'll see a lot of people around.

One of the coolest things you can do is, to move around the  Sena river near the shore, where you can find some seats to admire the cathedral. I did it and it's a great experience!

It is a must, if you are visiting Paris. Definitely, don't skip this of your list.

A must see place when visiting Paris! It’s free to get in and you don’t need to get any tickets in advance. During the busy season it’s best to get there early. We arrived at 8.45am and we walked straight in. It was still fairly quiet when we left at 10am.

details.vicinity: Cathédrale Notre Dame, 6 Parvis Notre-Dame - Pl. Jean-Paul II, Paris

reviews.text: Just a decent food experience, not worth experiencing when it comes to one star Michelin dining in my opinion. The service was friendly, a bit hurried at times. The dishes were not outstanding, the entrees were fine. The main fish dish wasn’t balanced and too acidic and the meat did not meet my expectations. The desert was good. Overall I would not come back here, price/value/finesse/taste/ambience is not satisfying

Chic Gem in The 2nd that made us feel like Locals.  We had the 6:30 seating and immediately were greeted pleasantly and seated at a lovely window table.  Perfectly timed service and exquisite courses all presented on artisanal pottery.  The bread is sublime and they offered us a second helping which we gladly enjoyed!  Each bite was fresh & new with a complexity of flavors.  A wonderful experience all around worthy of the Michelin star.  We will be back!

Frenchie is one of our favourite restaurants in the world.  The food, service and ambience is incredible!  Farm to table ingredients prepared with creativity and keen attention to the diner’s experience.  We purposely booked our vacation rental within walking distance of Frenchie so that it was close by and convenient.  Frenchie is a stellar restaurant every time we go!

We travel to try the best food and our experience at Frenchie was one of our absolute favorites. The food was the perfect balance of adventurous while being comforting. Through each dish, we could see and taste the attention to detail and thoughtfulness of the chef and his team. The service was excellent - it was intimate and did not waver for a moment. The wine pairing truly enhanced every bite. The entire team - front and back of house - was working from a place of pride and extending love in the form of service. Every employee was knowledgeable and added their own magic to the evening. We had the most incredible time and I could sing from the rooftops that Frenchie is the dinner you dream about when you dream about your Paris culinary finds.

From the first course to the final bite, the tasting menu was a triumph of flavor and technique. The standout of the night was, without question, the squab—perfectly cooked, tender, and rich, with a depth of flavor that lingered long after the last bite. It was a dish that showcased both restraint and mastery, and sitting just feet from the team as they plated it with quiet focus made the experience even more special.

details.adr_address: 5 Rue du Nil, 75002 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Rustic-chic stop for seasonal French dishes with global influences, plus chef's carte blanche menus.

Beautiful and magnificent. A little abused due to the age but worth the visit. Impressive confessionals, tableaus and architecture. The history is definitely recommended to be read. You may find homeless men sleeping around the outside of the building but with proper care and being vigilant this doesn't pose a threat.

I happened to be staying nearby and decided to wander in. To my pleasant surprise, there was no admission fee or wait to get in. The main reason I’m leaving a review is that I was truly overwhelmed by the beauty of this church. Despite visiting many other churches including St. Chapelle and Notre Dame, this one really stood out to me. It was one of my most memorable experiences while visiting Paris. I highly recommend visiting here to see the amazing architecture and sculptures.

Saint Germain l'Auxerrois, Paris France
As per architecture design this is so beautiful church

We accidentally stumbled upon this incredible church in Sept, so when I found myself back in Paris in Jan with my boys, I had to bring them here.  This is 1 of the most beautiful churches I've ever been into & I make it a point to go into every church I possibly can, wherever I visit.  It's right next to The Louvre, so if you find yourself in that area (& who doesn't when visiting Paris), then I absolutely recommend this gem.   It's truly spectacular & well worth the time.  In fact, every time I visit Paris, I will definitely visit here.  It's free to visit & you can purchase candles to light inside via cash, apple pay or Google wallet.  Even if you aren't spiritual,  there's something about being in these beautiful,  historical places that is just magical.

This has to be the most beautiful church we have visited in a very long time.

The flamboyant Gothic-style coupled with the most beautiful collection of stained glass windows makes it look fabulous.  Add in a magnificent selection of beautifully decorated side chapels and you have the opportunity to have your breath taken away.

What makes this all the more surprising it that it was almost devoid of visitors and yet it is directly opposite the Louvre.  A magnificent place to while away an hour or so.

details.adr_address: 2 Pl. du Louvre, 75001 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Gothic religious edifice with striking Renaissance stained-glass windows & intricately carved pews.

Booked that restaurant for 7.30pm dinner on July 3rd. After  an hour no one took care of us either for the menu presentation or the wine ordering at the bar. Very rude to witness that if you are not one the owners friends you can turn into dust before someone will pay attention to you. We just stood up and left after an hour of this circus very disappointed and will never set foot there again.
The food but especially the experience of ordering is great. Highly recommend

Very good wines and they will make sure you find a wine you really like.
Always a nice crowd and good mix of couples a group of friends
Fantastic place! Great selection of wine, friendly staff and delicious planchas!
A very nice atmosphere, great wines and food to share. Delicious.

The training exceeded the expectations stated, the duo of trainers (Elise and Fabrice) gave us all the keys to get started and helped us greatly by providing us with a personalized kit at the end of the training.
As for the place, comfortable welcome, excellent table, careful decoration, everything is perfect down to the smallest detail, true professionalism.

Great training, essential!
Elise and Fabrice are very professional, very friendly.
The content is complete, the immersion in guest rooms is a real plus.
The exchanges between project leaders, with our hosts and the trainers are very rich and bring a lot
To recommend

An intense and comprehensive training course aimed at opening a B&B. I really enjoyed this highly interactive course, which took into account the specifics of my own project. Elise and Fabrice, former hosts, were extremely knowledgeable about their subject. All this was enhanced with real-life anecdotes. Thank you for our constructive discussions.

Elise and Fabrice took care of our guesthouse for two weeks this summer. We were able to go on vacation, leaving the house in good hands, from welcoming our guests and managing the business, to caring for our animals and our home.
In addition to being highly professional and full of good advice for the future of our business, Elise, Fabrice, and their daughter Amélia are also wonderful people with whom it's a pleasure to interact.
A wonderful professional and personal encounter, one to be repeated ☺️
Sarah Raphaël and the boys, from Jardin des Cèdres

I attended the "Opening a Guesthouse or Gîte" training course with Elise and Fabrice. These 5 days were extremely rich in both information and human interaction. The comprehensive program (legal, tax, social, market and competition research, marketing, financial plan, etc.), the sharing of experiences from professionals such as Elise and Fabrice, and the experience of living this experience immersed in the setting of the La Paresse en Douce guesthouse at Helen and Henk's made this training unique and highly informative. I left with all my questions answered and a tenfold increase in energy to move forward with my project. I recommend it. Thank you all 4 for this wonderful week.

details.adr_address: 109 Av. du Limousin, 63100 Clermont-Ferrand, France

reviews.text:
The training exceeded the expectations stated, the duo of trainers (Elise and Fabrice) gave us all the keys to get started and helped us greatly by providing us with a personalized kit at the end of the training.
As for the place, comfortable welcome, excellent table, careful decoration, everything is perfect down to the smallest detail, true professionalism.

Great training, essential!
Elise and Fabrice are very professional, very friendly.
The content is complete, the immersion in guest rooms is a real plus.
The exchanges between project leaders, with our hosts and the trainers are very rich and bring a lot
To recommend

An intense and comprehensive training course aimed at opening a B&B. I really enjoyed this highly interactive course, which took into account the specifics of my own project. Elise and Fabrice, former hosts, were extremely knowledgeable about their subject. All this was enhanced with real-life anecdotes. Thank you for our constructive discussions.

Elise and Fabrice took care of our guesthouse for two weeks this summer. We were able to go on vacation, leaving the house in good hands, from welcoming our guests and managing the business, to caring for our animals and our home.
In addition to being highly professional and full of good advice for the future of our business, Elise, Fabrice, and their daughter Amélia are also wonderful people with whom it's a pleasure to interact.
A wonderful professional and personal encounter, one to be repeated ☺️
Sarah Raphaël and the boys, from Jardin des Cèdres

I attended the "Opening a Guesthouse or Gîte" training course with Elise and Fabrice. These 5 days were extremely rich in both information and human interaction. The comprehensive program (legal, tax, social, market and competition research, marketing, financial plan, etc.), the sharing of experiences from professionals such as Elise and Fabrice, and the experience of living this experience immersed in the setting of the La Paresse en Douce guesthouse at Helen and Henk's made this training unique and highly informative. I left with all my questions answered and a tenfold increase in energy to move forward with my project. I recommend it. Thank you all 4 for this wonderful week.

Day 2.name: Basilique Notre-Dame du Port
Day 2.address: 4 Rue Notre Dame du Port, Clermont-Ferrand

reviews.text: Visiting from Rue Robertus gives you a better view of the basilica and it's unique geometric shaped architecture. It was empty during the weekend giving a peaceful atmosphere to the visit. You have an access to the crypt too! Overall, it's a lovely romanesque styled basilica worth visiting for some peace :)
Beautiful old medieval  church. Free entry. Beautiful stained windows and decorative ceilings. Worth a visit

Truly amazing church of roman style. No further alterations in later centuries, but original as it was in 1140 when it was built. Ther is also a crypt below the apsis. The ceiling is very beautiful , in the area of the choir it is obvious that the architect had difficulties to combine the different elements into a cross shape. A must see when in clermont ferrand.
Make sure to check out the geometric designs at the east end on the outside!

A beautiful romanesque basilica with typical chevets and mosaics, among the five greatest churches in Auvergne (Issoire, Orcival, Saint-Nectaire, and Saint-Saturnin). Founded in the 6th century, burned down and rebuilt around the 12th, the building has been restored (questionably) in the 19th century, finally a major restoration programme took place in the church interior at the beginning of the 21st century (to clean the stonework and remove the 19th century cement adds) after the basilica was added to the UNESCO World Heritage (1998).

Day 3.name: Casa Champgil
Day 3.address: 23 rue des Vieillards, 23 Pl. du Champgil, Clermont-Ferrand

reviews.text: Beautifully designed this little hotel/hostel is a real find! Perfectly located in walking distance to cathedral and shops/cafes, yet hidden like a gem. 5 friends are running it together and the whole atmosphere couldn't be more welcoming and nice. We stayed with our 4 kids and were super happy. Highly recommend!!

The best hostel I ever stayed in France: Extremely clean, beautiful wooden furniture, super friendly staff and great location with an amazing inner court. If you visit Clermont, this is definitely the best adress. 10/10 would recommend and definitely come back.
Great stay in Clermont-Ferrand, lovely set up and very tranquil gardens. Host was excellent and very  accommodating.

Some of my fondest travel memories through the years have been of my experiences in hostels and the people I met there. Much time had passed however since I had visited Europe and stayed in a first rate hostel. So, in late autumn of 2024 I took the opportunity to visit France for the first time and stayed in the Casa Champgil for several weeks while carrying out a project. I'd originally intended to stay just a few days but I found the conditions so amenable to work and rest that I extended repeatedly and returned here after other journeys in the region. Anthony, the host is incredibly warm and gracious and I greatly enjoyed the many conversations I shared with him and the other travelers I met in the hostel over the several weeks. The vibe is super chill and I would recommend Casa Champgil to anyone visiting the city whether for a short visit or longer term, whether for work or to explore the city. Everything is brand new and extremely clean -- well the building actually dates I believe to the 1700s, but a good balance has been struck between retaining the best features of the older architecture with modern renovation and tasteful design undertaken in raw materials, everything in stone, wood, glass and steel with a natural and spare aesthetic. I particularly loved their decision to expose the original volcanic stone in the walls of the stairwell. The common area downstairs has numerous tables inside and in the courtyard and I enjoyed spending time there both socialising and getting work done in late hours, the beds are comfortable and I slept quite well most nights as travelers were generally thoughtful and quiet. I found the breakfast offered to be quite convenient and certainly worth paying for on a busy schedule, since Anthony kindly had the feast ready when I emerged from my quarters each morning, and introduced me to several of the local types of cheese and baguette as well as delicious croissants and other pastries. Importantly, the coffee was seriously excellent and I appreciated that Anthony took the trouble to make extra upon request! One other thing to note is that the hostel is a short walk from some great restaurants and cafes, as well as the Gaillard light rail stop which makes it very easy to reach other parts of town, including the Pardieu station at the terminus if you want to head elsewhere at some point. I am so grateful to Anthony and Casa Champgil for helping to making my stay in town pleasant and productive. I will certainly come back and stay at Casa Champgil, as my experience staying there has renewed my old faith in hostels and left me with a very high opinion of France and the French people.

A little heaven to create great memories. Made by inspired local entrepreneurs with craftsmanship, stones and wood work outstanding quality. Must visit when in Clermont for sleeping, yoga retreat or business seminars. Well done for your hard work.

reviews.text: Had lunch here and it was absolutely beautiful. The food was perfect and the service first class!

I’ve eaten in special restaurants before, but very few are so special as to be core memories.

I cannot explain just how sublime the lunch experience at JCL was - the most gracious service even with a child in our small party. The food indescribably good, the balance of textures and flavours a creation of absolute perfection.

Who cares what the price is? In comparison to what we have paid in Paris, Chamonix, or Lyon, it’s under priced.

If you’re in Clermont Ferrand don’t miss the opportunity. Please, take my advice!

Worth a Michelin star!
Great food for eyes and soul.
Great taste, great wine.
Excellent !!!

For a very long time I would have liked to be able to visit the interior of this splendid building and now I took advantage of the exhibition that is taking place to enjoy the beauty of the place.  The exhibition can be visited for free

Superb, astonishing, delightful...
The venue: a magnificent private mansion just a stone's throw from the cathedral (it's not accessible for people with reduced mobility). In the courtyard, you'll see the magnificent staircase you'll take for your visit.
I saw the bird exhibit. I wasn't initially enthusiastic about the theme, but...
The exhibit shows birds in different forms: classic black and white photos, color portraits of birds of paradise, and... I won't reveal the last, very surprising room. In short, I'm captivated.
É um prédio antigo e histórico. A entrada é gratuita e tem exposição de fotografia. Muito bonito vale a pena visitar. Tem bastante degraus para subir e não vi elevador.

Exhibition visited on the photographic work of Patrick Tourneboeuf, in residence at the Fontfreyde hotel. Different parts (meanwhile, steles, monumentum) presenting an interesting angle on places that we no longer see because they are abandoned (factory site Cataroux Michelin and other disused sites, or under renovation), or invisible because everyday (mortuary steles all over France). Beautiful immersion for the "monumentum" animation set to music. As a bonus, "empty your bag" on the ground floor, interesting and fun exhibition (we were left a little hungry, there would be so much to develop). And always the shelves of books on photography with free access. All in a place that is worth the detour in itself. A visit to do for all these reasons!

A magnificent place steeped in history to come and admire the photo exhibitions which are really well presented; several floors and different rooms very well laid out; culture accessible to all because entry is free; an absolute must-see...

If you’re looking for a refined yet affordable French dining experience, this Bib Gourmand restaurant is a gem. Their menu, featuring options of fish or meat, delivers fantastic food at a price that’s hard to believe for the quality on offer. Every dish is carefully prepared, showcasing the chef’s attention to detail and passion for traditional French cuisine.

The restaurant strikes a perfect balance between sophistication and accessibility. Whether you’re craving a perfectly cooked piece of fish or a hearty, flavor-packed meat dish, this is a spot where you’ll leave impressed without breaking the bank. A wonderful choice for anyone seeking a memorable French meal.

Also, if your dog is well behaved, it will be welcomed too!
Great experience, the food was so good flavoured. Service relaxed and friendly. Price surprisingly low for high quality food. Thank you @chardonnay
worth to taste delicious food. Very good lunch menu at very reasonable price. Two servers with smile all the time.

I visited with my wife, and my food was delicious. However, my wife had the "Buchers choice" which was lamb. Unfortunately, 80% of her meat was inedible  because of gristle. We mentioned this, and the waitress offered my wife a desert as compensation. My wife declined, and when the bill arrived, we were charged full price. We feel as though protit was put before our dining experience. I doubt we will go back, which is a shame as we have been many times before.
First timefor me trying French food, it was a great experience, and the staff are very nice 😍👍👍👍

Day 3.name: Cathedral of Our Lady of the Assumption
Day 3.address: Clermont-Ferrand Cathedral, Pl. de la Victoire, Clermont-Ferrand

reviews.text: Beautiful cathedral with fabulous stained glass window and alter area. Lots of bars and eateries surround.

Oh boy! This cathedral is the identity of Clermont-Ferrand and rightly so. Built with lava stone, it gives a dark colour to the cathedral making it unique to the other cathedrals in France which is usually built with limestone. It's a gothic masterpiece and one of the tallest in France. Not to mention, the stained glass windows inside the cathedral was so colourful. I'm impressed!

I have a beautiful experience to visit over here. Such a lovely and amazing place. Very impressive and Attractive. This church is so cool i highly recommend to visit this. You can go inside as well to look. I personally prefer summer time to visit cause winter time is so could over there. Cathedral Of our lady of the assumption is really good and it's my pleasure to visit here. Thanks

Stunning church with daily Mass and adoration. Unlike most other cathedrals Mass is held on the main altar which is beautiful.

Unfortunately like most cathedrals they’ve picked chairs instead of pews, making it difficult to kneel.

The church is stunning and built from lava stone, there is beautiful artwork and architecture to admire inside. The high ceilings reach all the way up to heaven, bringing us up there for Mass.
Really good gothic cathedral to visit with heaps of detail in the stained glass windows

details.adr_address: Pl. de la Victoire, 63000 Clermont-Ferrand, France

editorial_summary.overview: 13th-century Roman Catholic place of worship, built from lava stone with murals & 2 spires.

details.formatted_address: Pl. de la Victoire, 63000 Clermont-Ferrand, France
details.name: Cathedral of Our Lady of the Assumption

reviews.text: Beautiful cathedral with fabulous stained glass window and alter area. Lots of bars and eateries surround.

Oh boy! This cathedral is the identity of Clermont-Ferrand and rightly so. Built with lava stone, it gives a dark colour to the cathedral making it unique to the other cathedrals in France which is usually built with limestone. It's a gothic masterpiece and one of the tallest in France. Not to mention, the stained glass windows inside the cathedral was so colourful. I'm impressed!

I have a beautiful experience to visit over here. Such a lovely and amazing place. Very impressive and Attractive. This church is so cool i highly recommend to visit this. You can go inside as well to look. I personally prefer summer time to visit cause winter time is so could over there. Cathedral Of our lady of the assumption is really good and it's my pleasure to visit here. Thanks

Stunning church with daily Mass and adoration. Unlike most other cathedrals Mass is held on the main altar which is beautiful.

Unfortunately like most cathedrals they’ve picked chairs instead of pews, making it difficult to kneel.

The church is stunning and built from lava stone, there is beautiful artwork and architecture to admire inside. The high ceilings reach all the way up to heaven, bringing us up there for Mass.
Really good gothic cathedral to visit with heaps of detail in the stained glass windows

details.vicinity: Clermont-Ferrand Cathedral, Pl. de la Victoire, Clermont-Ferrand

reviews.text: If you’re a meat lover, this place is perfect for you! They have the most delicious meat I had in Clermont-Ferrand. Both beef and pork tastes extremely delicious, juicy and of high quality, perfectly seasoned. The two kinds of sauces also go very well with the meats. The potato pudding (or whatever they’re called) that comes with the mixed meat platters is extremely delicious! Reservation is highly recommended because this place fills up quickly. Do not recommend for vegetarians.

On the search for a place to dine, I stumbled upon this stylish place. Being quite early, I managed to get one of the few free tables (reservation recommended!) and ordered the menu with 3 small tapas-style dishes plus side dish and dessert. The Argentinian white wine was refreshing, smelled delicious and went well with the ceviche. But the highlights were certainly the "morceau du 'Cornicero'" - beef in my case -, the caponata side dish and the gazpacho. The quality and taste of the food and the great background music were only topped by the quality of service by the friendly waitress and her excellent recommendation for the red wine I had with the beef.
In case you're not at the edge of starvation, I recommend to replace the dessert with a coffee or digestif as the menu is quite substantial and definitely worth every cent. If you prefer smaller portions, just have one or two of the dishes instead of the menu and you'll be fine.
So, definitely I great place to spend an evening.

Nice place to eat Latin style foods. Imagine tapas but in bigger portions. The menu on a weeknight or weekend is 28€. Lots of choices and very nicely presented. It was tasty but not up to my expectations when compared to Lard et La Manière. I adored the pluma of Iberian pig (which is the dish I loved at lard et la manière). The tapenade of the grilled pepper was kind of bland. I did not enjoy the tacos as the cheese sauce was overwhelming. I would go back with friends but it wasn’t the best meal I’ve had.

Fresh tasty food
I didn’t like big menu from wood, it fall on me few times in my birthday 😒🥳
We had lunch there, I had their daily dish, the taste is light but good, simple but colorful and looked tasty.

What a stunning hotel. The top floor terrace room was incredible. Being able to see the Eiffel Tower and notre dame from your room is unbeatable! The service was fantastic, we really enjoyed the front desk. The bed was comfortable, the room was clean and spacious, a/c saved our butts, and the bathroom was sufficient. We had no noise in our room, which is impressive given its superb location.
The breakfast was not reliable. We had to wait a very long time for delivery to our room. I prepaid for each day breakfast, and one day it took so long we never got it… missed out on 40€. The elevator is also very tiny and slow, so plan accordingly.
Besides breakfast (recommend you skip), this hotel is really incredible.

This hotel was absolutely perfect for our trip. The accommodations were comfortable and the hotel is located in a great area. The reception with champagne was a nice touch and the breakfast offerings were great. All amenities were perfect, but the courtesy and helpfulness of the staff truly was remarkable. They were so friendly and went out of their way to make sure that we were comfortable, and really took their time to provide us great recommendations. Thanks especially to Vladimir and Adam who spent time to help us navigate and suggest how to spend our short time in Paris. We very much hope to return.

Rooms are small, but large for Paris standards. Our room had a small balcony with a view of the city and a table for 2. The location cannot be beat. It’s tucked away off of the main road, but very close to Notre Dame and many other sites. We walked everywhere. Many small restaurants near-bye. I felt very safe and the staff were courteous and helpful. Air conditioning was a huge plus as we visited in August. I would definitely stay again!

We had a very pleasurable stay at the Parc Saint-Severin Paris. The hotel staff was super friendly and helpful. We booked a superior double room. The room was very spacious, clean, functional and safe. The hotel is walking distance from most major attractions. We therefore did not have to book and pay for any Taxis. I will return to this hotel when I visit Paris again.

Directly in the centre of the Latin Quarter, surrounded by bustling streets full of bars and restaurants, only minutes from Notre Dahm, this beautiful little hotel is in a quiet street with almost no tourists or road noise, it's almost impossibly quiet for the location. The staff are amazing and knew us all by name within a couple of days. The rooms are small but comfortable. We will stay here again.

Ordered the Capannina pizza, it had the right amount of spiciness from the italian sausages, the dough was cooked to perfection, it was a great meal.
The waiters were very attentive, the order arrived within minutes although it was very busy. Recommend this place.
The service was great. The food was absolutely fabulous. My husband is a pizza snob and he could not say enough good things about it. Great wine selection. Beautiful desserts. 15/10 recommend.
The owner was so amazing! Such a sweet and genuine guy! He gave us great recommendations for the food. We had bruschetta and the truffle pizza. Highly recommend!!!

Excellent, welcoming restaurant located in one of Paris's most beautiful neighborhoods. The service is good and punctual, and the staff is generally friendly and courteous. We had two pizzas and a salad, but that was enough to understand that this is authentic Italian cuisine, worthy of its name.

Managed to get a walk-in table for my family of 4 and were greeted and served by the owner, such a nice guy.
The food was amazing. We all shared bruschetta,  pizza, a pasta and gnocchi dishes. All we're delicious. Great food, great service and overall fantastic little restaurant. Would definitely recommend.

Day 1.name: Romanian Orthodox Church of the Holy Archangels
Day 1.address: 9 Bis Rue Jean de Beauvais, Paris

reviews.text:
Situated in the heart of Paris, the Romanian Orthodox Church of the Holy Archangels offers a peaceful and intimate retreat from the city’s usual bustle.

We visited the Church for a wedding, and it was a truly memorable experience. The church may be modest in size, but it radiates a deep sense of peace and tradition.
Sublime.
Beautiful orthodox church with small coin for souvenirs shop!

Quite small for the needs of a cathedral. It has it's place in most classic touristic tours and a statue of Eminescu very close. Inside the original paintings were restored and it truly serves it's purpose of a place for God.
Historical Church and main Romanian Orthodox Cathedral in Paris. The place where the great sculptor Constantin Brâncuși worshipped.

reviews.text: Great food in a charming atmosphere, set in one of the oldest buildings in Paris. We tried the lunch menu and were delighted with every dish. The highlights were the meat and artichoke, and the croissant/brioche served with golden butter.

The food, service, and value for money are all excellent. I was very satisfied with the meal, and the service was also excellent. I highly recommend visiting if you come to Paris. Additionally, the bathrooms are the cleanest and most well-equipped of all the ones I've seen in Paris. Everything is perfect.

I was part of a group of 3 that dined here in September. It was an amazing experience. The combination of the flavors and creativity of the food really shines, and the service was outstanding. I will be sure to reserve another dining experience here if I visit Paris again!

My first Michelin restaurant. I walked away with a beautiful experience, but my stomach couldn't handle all the different ingredients. I'm not allergic to anything, but something didn't agree with me. We tried the tasting menu, but had to stop mid-way because it was too much food for me.

Genius and delicious food, I took the 5 courses Thank you sincerely to the chef first of all and the kitchen team for the genius amazing taste that i couldn’t believe how delicious it was and how the mix was unique and creative and very fun to eat , I felt so happy with each course. Thank you to Antoine and Bathilde for making my experience amazing with your help explanation taking care of me and smiles

reviews.text:
Had a great first leg of our trip at this hotel. Such a great staff, beautiful room, centrally located. Walking distance to everything in the heart of Paris. Great food options all around, shopping, etc.

Stayed as a family of four with small children. Would love to return one day.

Relais Christine is one of our most favorite hotels in the world! We LOVE the staff and the quiet elegance of the experience provided. The rooms are full of comfort and luxury surroundings, lovely spa and wonderful breakfast. We are hoping to return soon!!

My husband and I recently visited Paris and stayed at Relais Christine. This was my second time staying at this hotel (the first time was in 2016) and it met and exceeded all of my expectations. The staff is wonderful, the property is lovely, the rooms are nice with great bedding, the breakfast is delicious and the location is perfect. This is the only hotel I'll ever need to stay at in Paris!

Our two night stay at the Relais Christine was amazing.  The common spaces, as well as our room, were beautiful, and so comfortable. We were greeted by staff who met our every need at all times of day, and enjoyed a delicious breakfast and cappuccino each morning.  The bikes were a lovely touch, and some of our party enjoyed a morning bike ride to the Eiffel Tower!

Probably one of the poorest 5 star experience we’ve ever had, and I compare this to similar boutique experiences and not large chains.
I have booked via booking and was informed when selecting the Duplex that it holds a bedroom, a sofa bed and one extra bed is available upon request. Given that I traveled with my husband, two toddler children and our nanny, I have booked 2 identical rooms even though it was well above our needs. We got there and I was refused when requesting the extra bed not based on lack of availability but “french law”. Once I’ve shown the room description and confirmation a bed can be added I was suggested that one child can sleep in the other room(?!) or that we can have an upgrade the next day. It was not the lack of solution that bothered me ( as they know, i have made it work as it was and didn’t fall mesmerized by the free upgrade) - but the attitude and lack of understanding on what the issue actually was.

Another things that left me
baffled for a 5 stars experience - you need to figure out where breakfast is? how to reach a room service menu? basically a total lack of service or information available unless you intentionally seek it. And spoiled fresh juice at breakfast at 7 AM is hardly understandable.

Lastly, what probably made me even write this review was that we were given a checkout time of 1 PM on only one of the rooms and our request to keep it until 1:30 as we flew out at 4 was deemed as impossible.

It’s a great great location but the experience was exactly 3 stars, just like my rating.

Nice collection of art. Very affordable/fair prices compared to many other museums and galleries. The collection wasn't as large as I imagined, especially being such a large building. But it's worth a visit. There are some great photo opportunities from above, and the impressionists art is fantastic.

This place is honestly incredible! Due to limited time I focused on my personal favourite - Impressionists but you could easily spend a whole day here. The building itself it stunning.

Would recommend going out of peak season, I visited in August and it was very busy. I wonder how it would feel with less hustle and bustle.

A memorable part of my trip to Paris!

Also there is a queue for tickets to be bought on the day. It was swift (5-10mins) and easy.

I'm using Paris Museum Pass, just join the line via Entrance C.

This is one of the coolest art museums in Paris, it’s a must-visit if you’re Van Gogh's fan or simply into art. What makes it really special is that the building itself used to be a huge train station, it was the Gare d’Orsay, built around the early 1900s. Instead of tearing it down, they turned it into a museum, which means you get this amazing mix of old industrial architecture and art all in one place.

Inside, the museum is packed with incredible artworks, mostly from the late 19th and early 20th centuries. You’ll find tons of famous Impressionist and Post-Impressionist paintings here, artists like Monet, Degas, Renoir, Van Gogh, and Cézanne. If you love those bright, colorful paintings or want to get a feel for the art that changed the world, this is the spot.

Besides paintings, the museum also has sculptures, decorative arts, and photography. It’s pretty manageable in size, so you don’t get overwhelmed like in some bigger museums.

The museum sits right on the left bank of the Seine, close to the Louvre and the charming Saint-Germain area. So, it’s easy to fit it into a day of exploring Paris.

It's recommended to visit here. :)

Everybody knows how fantastic these places. The museum itself is just simply fantastic.  Well organized and clean easy to get around. Advice: get Timed Tickets otherwise  lines are really long. Audio guide well worth a little extra to learn about the paintings. Many different spots to take photos.

The card can get very big around famous artists and pictures.

5 start!! Bring comfortable shoes :-)

Do not miss this architectural and artistic gem! Do a bit of research first so you target the areas of greatest interest. Impressionists and Art Nuveau were a must for me. Meals are available in various places and they are good. Only downside is the layout of the building, it can be confusing. But the staff were helpful and we found our way at the end. (Uploaded photos are from two different trips to the museum)

It's recommended to visit here. :)

Everybody knows how fantastic these places. The museum itself is just simply fantastic.  Well organized and clean easy to get around. Advice: get Timed Tickets otherwise  lines are really long. Audio guide well worth a little extra to learn about the paintings. Many different spots to take photos.

The card can get very big around famous artists and pictures.

5 start!! Bring comfortable shoes :-)

Do not miss this architectural and artistic gem! Do a bit of research first so you target the areas of greatest interest. Impressionists and Art Nuveau were a must for me. Meals are available in various places and they are good. Only downside is the layout of the building, it can be confusing. But the staff were helpful and we found our way at the end. (Uploaded photos are from two different trips to the museum)

This place brought me to tears and I'm not Jewish. Went to see the current temporary photographic exhibition not realising it was a memori to the lives of the French Jewish population during WWII and earlier. Such a humbling experience. It was free but I would've paid.
An incredibly profound and sad experience. Most placards have English translations, so the experience is not in any way diminished if a visitor does not speak French.
So powerful to see and remember the french jews, victims of a genocide,and stand with them and stand today facing history in our difficult times

This memorial is for the resistance fighters and Jewish people deported from France to concentration camps during WWII. It is very somber. The art is very well done and creates the feeling and mood I believe the artist was trying for. It is free to visit. Be certain to ask for the audio guide. (also free) as it explains a lot about the art and the history enshrined In the memorial.

Free to enter but please leave a donation to support this powerful memorial to the holocaust. While there are many emotional exhibits, the most moving is the interviews between French youth and Holocaust survivors with the theme of "I promise to be the memory of your memory. "

details.adr_address: 17 Rue Geoffroy l'Asnier, 75004 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Free-entry Holocaust museum & memorial with photographs, documents & multi-media displays.

We spend two nights in this lovely hotel and we were very happy! The personal is friendly, the room looked good. The breakfast was fresh and had a good quality. Overall it is a nice place to spend your holiday or your business trip. Thanks to it‘s location, you are fast in the city.

I cannot say enough good about this hotel. Upon arrival we were greeted by Thomas, who had a marvelous personality. He greeted us with a glass of champagne. Although he also offered beer or wine if you liked. He gave us great information regarding the area and answered all our questions. The rooms were beautiful and spotless. Bathrooms were good size with rain showers, nice hot water and toiletries. There was a Nepresso machine,  which we all love! As well as a Marshall speaker, so we could listen to our music. Highly recommend! All of the staff were fantastic.
Judy USA

We stayed at Le General Hotel for two nights and had such a lovely time. The location couldn’t be better—really central and just a minute from the metro, which made exploring Paris super easy. The staff were all so friendly and helpful, which we really appreciated. Our room was cosy and quiet, and the bed was very comfy! Loved the robe and slippers too, such a nice touch. Big thank you to the team for making our stay so enjoyable—we’d definitely come back and recommend this hotel when visiting Paris!

I stayed for two nights for my birthday and I have never been treated this nice in my life. Thomas especially, you are the most amazing man! I will forever be grateful for how you and all of your staff treated me and my friend. I hope I can come back as soon as possible and I hope I can repay you or at least the universe gives you endless good karma! ❤️ everything was so clean and nice and beds super comfy, location is amazing and felt so safe but the people were the highlight!

We loved our stay. Staff takes pride in their work. Great location right next to several metro stops that make the whole city easily accessible. Rooms were small but that’s normal for Paris. AC was a god-send on hot days. Great vibes in the lobby to hang out with free croissants and such. Would recommend!

details.adr_address: 5-7 Rue Rampon, 75011 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Cool, fashionable quarters with Nespresso machines & free Wi-Fi, plus a bar & a fitness room.

Day 3.name: Notre-Dame Cathedral of Paris
Day 3.address: Cathédrale Notre Dame, 6 Parvis Notre-Dame - Pl. Jean-Paul II, Paris

reviews.text: Wonderful to see the restored splendour of this magnificent cathedral after the awful fire of 2019.  Free to enter, long queue but moved quickly and only took about 20 minutes to get inside.  There was a mass taking place when we visited so it was very busy inside but it was lovely to hear the organ music and singing showcasing the wonderful acoustics.  I would recommend timing your visit to coincidence with a service as this is an experience not to be missed.  The artwork and stained glass are exquisite and you have a real sense of history as you walk round this remarkable building which had played such an central part in the story of the French nation.

Iconic cathedral, so well known, no review is needed.  It continues to be restored by artisans and workers who are preserving and restoring the structure to inspire people for generations.  Expect scaffolding to still be around the outside structure for another few years.  The inside is gorgeous and looks as good or better than it has in 900 years.  The walk-up lines move pretty quickly and the tours are worth it.  Bathrooms are not available on site.  Pay toilets are nearby.

You do not need a ticket to enter! There are tour companies selling tickets but honestly, get in the line (looks super long but moves super fast - it’s basically a continuous loop in, around, and out) and check out this iconic cathedral. Even if you’re not catholic or religious, you can appreciate the beauty and wonder in awe how it was built. It’s still under construction on the outside from the fire, but inside it’s great.

What an amazing symbol of Gothic architecture! This is one of the oldest Gothic cathedrals. It's located at the downtown of the beautiful city of Paris.

The building is very popular, so probably when you visit it, you'll see a lot of people around.

One of the coolest things you can do is, to move around the  Sena river near the shore, where you can find some seats to admire the cathedral. I did it and it's a great experience!

It is a must, if you are visiting Paris. Definitely, don't skip this of your list.

A must see place when visiting Paris! It’s free to get in and you don’t need to get any tickets in advance. During the busy season it’s best to get there early. We arrived at 8.45am and we walked straight in. It was still fairly quiet when we left at 10am.

address_components.long_name: Parvis Notre Dame - Place Jean-Paul II

editorial_summary.overview: Towering, 12th-century cathedral with flying buttresses & gargoyles, setting for Hugo's novel.

details.vicinity: Cathédrale Notre Dame, 6 Parvis Notre-Dame - Pl. Jean-Paul II, Paris

reviews.text: Beautiful and magnificent. A little abused due to the age but worth the visit. Impressive confessionals, tableaus and architecture. The history is definitely recommended to be read. You may find homeless men sleeping around the outside of the building but with proper care and being vigilant this doesn't pose a threat.

I happened to be staying nearby and decided to wander in. To my pleasant surprise, there was no admission fee or wait to get in. The main reason I’m leaving a review is that I was truly overwhelmed by the beauty of this church. Despite visiting many other churches including St. Chapelle and Notre Dame, this one really stood out to me. It was one of my most memorable experiences while visiting Paris. I highly recommend visiting here to see the amazing architecture and sculptures.

Saint Germain l'Auxerrois, Paris France
As per architecture design this is so beautiful church

We accidentally stumbled upon this incredible church in Sept, so when I found myself back in Paris in Jan with my boys, I had to bring them here.  This is 1 of the most beautiful churches I've ever been into & I make it a point to go into every church I possibly can, wherever I visit.  It's right next to The Louvre, so if you find yourself in that area (& who doesn't when visiting Paris), then I absolutely recommend this gem.   It's truly spectacular & well worth the time.  In fact, every time I visit Paris, I will definitely visit here.  It's free to visit & you can purchase candles to light inside via cash, apple pay or Google wallet.  Even if you aren't spiritual,  there's something about being in these beautiful,  historical places that is just magical.

This has to be the most beautiful church we have visited in a very long time.

The flamboyant Gothic-style coupled with the most beautiful collection of stained glass windows makes it look fabulous.  Add in a magnificent selection of beautifully decorated side chapels and you have the opportunity to have your breath taken away.

What makes this all the more surprising it that it was almost devoid of visitors and yet it is directly opposite the Louvre.  A magnificent place to while away an hour or so.

details.adr_address: 2 Pl. du Louvre, 75001 Paris, France

editorial_summary.overview: Gothic religious edifice with striking Renaissance stained-glass windows & intricately carved pews.

I would say this was the best hotel experience I’ve ever had—not just one of the best, but truly the most enjoyable.

Park Hyatt is always known for luxury, but the Milan property is on another level.

During our month-long trip across Europe (France → UK → Italy), we stayed at Park Hyatt hotels in Paris and London as Globalist. Milan, however, stood out the most. The team was outstanding! From the moment we arrived, the concierge gave us a warm welcome and even remembered our names throughout the stay. I also highly appreciated the front desk staff, who went the extra mile to fulfill my request for a room with a vanity table. After weeks of traveling, having a spacious bathroom and closet was exactly what I needed to refresh—doing my nails, tidying up, and enjoying a relaxing bubble bath.

We stayed 4 days and 3 nights, trying the restaurant for a birthday dinner, the bar for happy hour, and of course their signature breakfast. Every experience was excellent and reflected the best of Italian hospitality—stylish, warm, and full of character.

No wonder so many people say Park Hyatt Milan is the best in the group—I couldn’t agree more, and I’d highly recommend it to anyone visiting the city.

I visited the Park Hyatt in Milan for lunch with my family, and the experience was extremely disappointing. From the moment we were seated, the service was shockingly poor. It took ages just to be handed menus, while other tables who arrived after us were quickly served and attended to.

The restaurant wasn’t even busy, so there was no excuse for the delay. What made it worse was the clear difference in how we were treated compared to other guests—it felt borderline racist. We were made to feel invisible. My young son was hungry and restless, and no one made any effort to check on us or acknowledge the situation.

My wife voiced her complaints directly to staff, making it clear that we were unhappy with how we were being treated. Despite this, no one seemed to care. Even the manager, while polite, offered no genuine apology or meaningful resolution.

Eventually, we had no choice but to walk out. We went to enjoy lunch elsewhere—somewhere we were treated with basic respect.

This kind of experience is unacceptable at any establishment, let alone one carrying the Hyatt name. If you’re a family or a guest from a diverse background, I strongly urge you to consider other options when in Milan.

Park Hyatt Milan was hands down the best hotel we stayed at during our time in Italy. From the moment we arrived, the service was impeccable — the doormen were attentive and welcoming, the front desk and room service teams were top-tier, and housekeeping kept everything spotless and perfectly maintained.

The rooms were absolutely beautiful — elegant, spacious, and thoughtfully designed. Breakfast each morning was a delight, with high-quality offerings and great service to match.

If I had one wish, it would be for a larger gym, but that’s a small note in an otherwise flawless experience. Highly recommend for anyone looking for refined luxury and world-class hospitality in Milan.

We stayed several nights and had an excellent experience.  Bathrooms with high end luxuries as expected including soaking tub and shower. Bidets in the room. We dined at several Michelin star restaurants during our time in Milan and the breakfast at the hotel was still a highlight. The staff go out of their way to be helpful and welcoming. Most impressive was a conversation with the bartender who opined about how well they are treated as staff by the general manager, especially during the remodel and shutdown over the pandemic. Got the sense that they really believe in the hotel and their service. Would recommend without reservation.

Pretty decent? There’s no lobby basically, breakfast is pretty simple. Came on Guest of Honor but no upgrade (I think hotel was pretty fully booked). Guest room was tiny like what you might imagine from a European hotel. Housekeeping is probably the only stand out here. Bed linens.

details.adr_address: V. Tommaso Grossi, 1, 20121 Milano MI, Italy

editorial_summary.overview: Elegant rooms & suites in an upmarket property featuring a cafe, a renowned restaurant & a spa.
